intro: Gilia gypsophila, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and they bloom in the summer months. Gilia gypsophila is also known for its ability to reseed itself, making it a resilient and hardy species.
